# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/win32-x64/lldb/lib/encodings/cp1006.py
@source-hash: eaded38b427841bd
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:10:37Z

**Python Character Encoding CP1006 Implementation**

Auto-generated character mapping codec for CP1006 encoding (IBM Arabic for Urdu). Implements Python's codecs API for bidirectional conversion between bytes and Unicode text in the CP1006 character set.

## Core Components

**Codec (L9-15)**: Main codec class providing encode/decode methods. Uses `codecs.charmap_encode/decode` with predefined mapping tables.

**IncrementalEncoder (L17-19)**: Stateful encoder for streaming data, returns only encoded bytes without error information.

**IncrementalDecoder (L21-23)**: Stateful decoder for streaming data, returns only decoded text without error information.

**StreamWriter/StreamReader (L25-29)**: File-like objects combining codec functionality with stream I/O capabilities through multiple inheritance.

**getregentry() (L33-42)**: Registration function returning CodecInfo object that Python's encoding system uses to register this codec as 'cp1006'.

## Data Tables

**decoding_table (L47-304)**: 256-element tuple mapping byte values (0x00-0xFF) to Unicode characters. First 128 entries (0x00-0x7F) are standard ASCII. Extended range (0x80-0xFF) maps to Arabic script characters and control codes.

**encoding_table (L307)**: Reverse mapping automatically built from decoding_table using `codecs.charmap_build()` for efficient Unicode-to-byte conversion.

## Character Set Details
- 0x00-0x7F: Standard ASCII characters
- 0x80-0x9F: Control characters  
- 0xA0-0xFF: Arabic/Urdu script characters including:
  - Extended Arabic-Indic digits (0xA1-0xAA)
  - Arabic punctuation marks
  - Various Arabic letter forms (isolated, initial, medial, final)
  - Diacritical marks

## Dependencies
- `codecs` module for all encoding/decoding operations and base classes

## Architecture Notes
Uses Python's charmap codec framework for simple byte-to-Unicode table lookups. Generated code pattern ensures consistency with other encoding modules in Python's standard library.
